intro: Pleurostachys guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan pleurostachys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Guyana, Suriname, and French Guiana. This grass-like plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments, often in lowland forests or along riverbanks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
